Metra Electric All trains will ground load  75th to 11th

ME All trains will ground load at 111th, 107th, 103rd, 95th, 91st, 87th, 83rd, 79th, and 75th Street. Please wait visible to the engineer, do not operate chains or gates in ground load areas, follow train crew's instructions after the train stops

MED outbound trains will board from the north end of the platform at 47th, 27th, 23rd McCormick Place and 18th St

Outbound trains will board from the north end of the platform at 18th, McCormick Place, 27th and 47th street. Please wait on the platform visible to the engineer and follow boarding instructions from the conductor after the train stops.

BNSF 1227 Delayed
Train #1227 scheduled to arrive Aurora at 12:51 p.m. may be operating 15 to 20 minutes behind schedule due to freight train interference. Visit MetraTracker.com for the location of your train.

UPW 31 Delayed 15 to 20 Minutes
Train 31, scheduled to arrive Elburn at 1:08 p.m., is operating 15 to 20 minutes behind schedule due to a switch failure.

ME Hazel Crest elevator is out of service
The Hazel Crest elevator is out of service. Customers can use Harvey or Flossmoor as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.

BNSF 1256 Stopped

Train #1256 scheduled to arrive Chicago at 12:20 p.m. is stopped near Hollywood/Zoo Stop due to freight train interference. Delay times are unknown. An update will be provided when this train is on the move.

The Van Buren Michigan Street Island elevator is out of service
The Van Buren Michigan Street elevator is out of service. Customers can use the South Water Elevator at Millennium Station or Museum Campus as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - 87th street/Woodruff Station Closure Beginning December 16 - Station Rebuild Project

The 87th street/Woodruff station on the Metra Electric line will be closed beginning Monday, December 16. During this time passengers can use 83rd and 91st street stations as alternatives. This is part of the Metra Electric Community initiative to transform multiple stations on the Metra Electric District. Once completed, the station will have an enclosed ADA-accessible street-level entrance, lobby with an elevator, new stairs, headhouses, new composite deck platforms, new lighting, and signage. The station is expected to reopen in late 2025. For more information visit metra.com.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - 79th Street/Chatham Station
The 79th Street/Chatham station on the Metra Electric may not be fully ADA accessible Monday through Friday from 9:00 AM to 4:00 PM.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - The 95th St/Chicago State University station will close March 3, 2025 - Station Rehab and Expansion Project

On Monday, March 3, the 95th st/Chicago State University station will close for approximately 2 years to undergo a rehabilitation and expansion project. During this time passengers should use 91st street and 103rd st/Rosemoor stations as alternates. Updates will be provided.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME -  103rd St./Rosemoor Station ADA Accessibility.
Monday through Friday, from 9AM to 4PM, the 103rd St,/Rosemoor station may not be fully ADA accessible due to nearby station construction.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert MD-N - Fox Lake Station Platform Closure

Attention Fox Lake Station passengers: The north end of the Fox Lake platform and a section of the north parking lot will be closed until further notice for construction at the depot. Trains will load and unload from the south end of the platform.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert MD-N -  Golf rehabilitation project will start on Monday April 14, 2025

Beginning Monday, April 14, the Golf station south half of Platforms 1 and 2 will be out of service including the pedestrian crosswalk and ADA ramp for rehabilitation for approximately 6 weeks. Recommended alternative accessible locations are Glenview and Morton Grove.  After completion of the south half, the north half of Platforms 1and 2 will be out of service for approximately 6 weeks to complete the rehabilitation project. Metra will update this station with additional information as it becomes available. We apologize for any inconvenience.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - Metra Electric Partial Shut Down Saturday, May 3rd and Sunday, May 4th - NICTD Expansion Project

On Saturday, May 3rd and Sunday, May 4th, Metra Electric trains will terminate and originate at 18th Street due to the NICTD expansion project. Metra Electric trains will be operating on a Sunday schedule both days. During this time no service will be available at Museum Campus/11th Street and Van Buren Street. ADA customers and those with mobility needs must transfer at McCormick Place to board a paratransit bus if they are traveling to and from Millennium Station. All other customers wishing to travel to and from Millennium Station must transfer to a shuttle bus at 18th Street.  If you need help or have questions, please see Metra personnel for assistance.
